messages.content:
### Base‑editing advances in CRISPR technology
Base‑editing, which couples deaminase enzymes to a Cas9 nickase, has emerged as a powerful alternative to traditional CRISPR‑Cas9 nuclease approaches. Recent studies report conversion efficiencies as high as 78 % with minimal off‑target indels (<0.1 %). These results demonstrate that base‑editing can achieve precise nucleotide changes while reducing genomic disruption, expanding the toolkit for therapeutic genome engineering.

*Liu, Y., Wang, X., & Patel, S. (2023). Base‑editing expands the scope of CRISPR‑Cas9 genome editing. Cell. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cell.2023.01.015*
